ingredients.name: All-Purpose Flour
ingredients.notes: Unbleached, 12 lb bag from Costco Waltham MA

ingredients.name: Orange Liqueur
ingredients.notes: Triple sec, Total Wine Burlington MA

ingredients.name: Egg Yolks
ingredients.notes: From Large Eggs, Costco Waltham MA

ingredients.name: Walnuts
ingredients.notes: Halves and pieces, Costco Waltham MA

ingredients.name: Apricot Halves
ingredients.notes: In heavy syrup, Wegmans Burlington MA

variants.notes: Unbleached, 12 lb bag from Costco Waltham MA
Triple sec, Total Wine Burlington MA
From Large Eggs, Costco Waltham MA
Halves and pieces, Costco Waltham MA
In heavy syrup, Wegmans Burlington MA

recipes.name: Almond Biscotti
recipes.notes: Beat butter until softened. Add 1 cup flour, sugar, eggs, baking powder, vanilla; beat till combined. Stir in remaining flour and nuts. Divide in half. Shape into 9-inch logs, 2 inches wide. Place 4 inches apart on ungreased sheet. Bake 325°F for 1 hour. Cool 1 hour. Cut diagonally into ½-inch slices. Lay cut side down. Bake 325°F 8 minutes, turn, bake 8-10 minutes more till dry and crisp. Cool. Optional: melt chocolate with shortening, drizzle over cookies.

recipes.name: Butterscotch Pumpkin Cake
recipes.notes: Preheat 350°F. Grease bundt pan. Microwave 1 cup butterscotch morsels MEDIUM HIGH 70% 1 min; stir till melted. Cool. Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, salt, nutmeg. Whisk melted morsels, pumpkin, oil, eggs, vanilla. Stir in flour. Pour into pan. Bake 40-50 min till pick clean. Cool 30 min, remove from pan. Dust with powdered sugar. Sauce: heat 1/3 cup evaporated milk to boil, remove. Add remaining morsels, stir smooth. Return to heat, bring to boil. Cool.

recipes.name: Chocolate Truffle Croquembouche
recipes.notes: Boil cream and butter. Add 2.5 lb chocolate; whisk smooth. Whisk in sour cream, liqueur, orange peel. Pour into 9x13 dish, refrigerate 1 hr. Line 4 sheets: 2 with powdered sugar, 2 with cocoa. Scoop truffles onto sheets. Freeze 10 min. Roll in coating, then hands. Freeze 15 min. Melt white chocolate to 115°F. Dip sugar truffles, refrigerate 1 hr. Repeat for double coat. Melt 1.5 lb bittersweet to 115°F. Wave spoon over white truffles making zigzags. Repeat process for remaining truffles. Assemble on cone with toothpicks in spiral.

recipes.name: Gingerbread Chai Cookies
recipes.notes: Preheat 350°F. Beat butter, 2/3 cup sugar, vanilla till fluffy 2-3 min. Beat in egg, molasses. Whisk flour, cardamom (1/2 cup), cinnamon (2.5 tbsp), ginger (6 tsp total), cloves (2 tsp), pepper (2 tsp), baking soda, salt. Add to butter on low. Beat on medium 2 min. Roll dough 1/2 inch thick. Scoop into 2-inch balls. Roll in 1 cup sugar. Place 2.5 inches apart. Bake 15-16 min till cracked. Cool on pans.

recipes.name: Jumbles
recipes.notes: Line sheet with parchment. Preheat 350°F. Mix flour, baking soda, salt. Beat butter 30 sec. Beat in sugars. Beat in eggs, vanilla. Beat in flour as much as possible. Stir in remaining flour. Stir in nuts, raisins, chocolate. Drop 1/4 cup dough 3 inches apart. Bake 12-15 min till golden and set. Stand 5 min. Transfer to rack; cool. Store in refrigerator up to 3 days or freeze up to 3 months.

recipes.name: Sour Cream-Chocolate Bundt Cake
recipes.notes: Room temp ingredients. Preheat 325°F. Grease flour bundt pan. Sift flour, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda, salt twice. Beat butter smooth 30-45 sec. Add 1.5 cups sugar on low. Beat medium-high till fluffy 3-5 min. Add eggs gradually till thick 1-2 min. Beat in vanilla. Fold in flour in 3 additions alternating with sour cream, beginning and ending with flour. Fold in 6 oz melted chocolate. Pour into pan. Bake 1 hour till pick clean. Cool 10 min. Glaze: heat 1 cup sugar, 1/2 cup milk till dissolved. Stir in 1 tbsp liqueur. Invert cake. Brush with glaze. Dust with powdered sugar. Serve with whipped cream.

recipes.name: Almond Flour Brownies
recipes.notes: Follow KA instructions; bake until set with a few moist crumbs.

recipes.name: Toasted Almond Sablés
recipes.notes: Toast sliced almonds; roll to 1/2-inch; chill dough for clean cuts.

recipes.name: Gluten-Free Almond Flour Shortbread Cookies
recipes.notes: Combine; scoop 1" balls; flatten with fork; bake 8–10 min.

recipes.name: Candy-Bar Fudge
recipes.notes: Microwave or stovetop method; fold peanuts and caramels before topping with semisweet chocolate.

recipes.name: Lavender-Lemon Cake with Honey Glaze
recipes.source: Flo Braker, The Simple Art of Perfect Baking (scan)

recipes.name: Holiday Blossoms
recipes.yield_description: flower-shaped cookies with mint chocolate centers

ingredients.notes: one candy in center of each cookie

recipes.name: Individual Orange and Poppy Seed Pound Cake
recipes.notes: Preheat oven to 350°F. Butter and flour four 5¾x3¼x1⅞-inch loaf pans. Sift flour, baking powder and salt into medium bowl. Using electric mixer, beat sugar and unsalted butter in large bowl until light and fluffy. Add eggs 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in orange juice, grated orange peel and vanilla extract (batter may look curdled). Beat in flour mixture. Fold in poppy seeds. Divide batter equally among prepared pans (about 1½ cups each). Place pans in oven. Bake until tester inserted in center comes out clean, about 55 minutes. Transfer pans to racks. Cool cakes in pans 10 minutes. Turn cakes out onto wire racks and cool completely.

recipes.name: Lemon Bliss Cake
recipes.source: King Arthur Baking - 2017 Recipe of the Year
recipes.notes: Preheat oven to 350°F. Beat butter, sugar, and salt until combined, then fluffy and lightened in color. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Scrape sides and bottom once all eggs added, beat briefly to re-combine. Measure flour by gently spooning into cup, then sweeping off excess. Whisk baking powder into flour. Add flour mixture to batter in three parts alternately with milk, starting and ending with flour. Batter may look slightly curdled when you add milk - that's OK; it'll smooth out as you add flour. Mix until well combined; batter will look a bit rough, but shouldn't have large lumps. Stir in grated lemon rind or lemon oil. Thoroughly grease 10-12 cup Bundt pan. Spoon batter into prepared pan, leveling and smoothing top with spatula. Bake 45-60 minutes, until cake tester or toothpick comes out clean. Pan with dark interior will bake more quickly; start checking at 40 minutes. While cake bakes, make glaze by stirring together lemon juice and sugar. Microwave or heat over burner briefly, stirring to dissolve sugar. Don't cook lemon juice; microwave until very warm, but not uncomfortably hot - less than 1 minute. Remove cake from oven, carefully run knife between cake and pan all around edge. Place pan upside down on serving plate. Let cool 15 minutes before removing pan. Poke holes in warm cake with toothpick. Brush glaze over warm cake. Cool completely before serving.

ingredients.notes: 2 cups for cake, 0.75 cup for glaze
finely grated rind, or 0.75 tsp lemon oil
freshly squeezed juice for glaze, about 1.5 lemons

recipes.name: Noel Bell Fruit Cake
recipes.notes: Grease a loaf pan, 9x5x3. Sift flour, baking powder, cinnamon, mace, and cloves onto wax paper. Cream butter or margarine with brown sugar until fluffy; light in a large bowl; beat in eggs, one at a time; stir in apricots and whiskey. Stir in flour mixture until blended, then raisins, mixed fruits, pecans, and cherries. Spoon into prepared pan; spread top even. Bake in slow oven (300°) 2 hours, or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool completely in pan on a wire rack. Loosen cooled cake around the edges with a knife; turn out onto rack.

ingredients.notes: drained and chopped, from 1 lb can

recipes.name: Marble Fruit Cake
recipes.notes: Sift flour, baking powder, salt, baking soda, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and cloves onto wax paper. Cream butter or margarine with brown sugar until fluffy in a large bowl; beat in eggs, one at a time; stir in currant jelly and apple juice. Stir in flour mixture until blended, then candied fruits, dates, walnuts, and currants. Spoon half of batter into a greased 9-inch tube pan. Combine granulated sugar, lemon rind, and lemon sections; spoon over batter in pan. Top with remaining batter. Bake in slow oven (300°) for 1¾ hours, or until a long thin skewer inserted near center comes out clean. Cool completely in pan on a wire rack. Loosen around edge with a knife; turn out onto rack.

recipes.name: Pecan Shortbread Christmas Trees
recipes.notes: In bowl of stand mixer fitted with paddle attachment, beat butter, confectioners' sugar, and salt at medium speed until light and creamy, 2 to 3 minutes, stopping to scrape sides of bowl. Beat in vanilla. In medium bowl, whisk together flours. With mixer on low speed, add flour mixture to butter mixture in two additions, beating just until combined after each addition. Turn out dough, and shape into a disk. Wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate until firm, about 2 hours, or up to overnight. Preheat oven to 325°F (170°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper. On lightly floured surface, roll dough to ½-inch thickness. Using 4-inch tree-shaped cutter, cut dough, rerolling scraps as necessary. Place 1½ inches apart on prepared pans. Bake until edges are lightly browned, 20 to 25 minutes, rotating pans halfway through baking. Let cool on pans 10 minutes. Remove from pans, and let cool completely on wire racks. Spoon melted white chocolate into piping bag, and cut very small opening in tip. Pipe onto cookies to resemble garland; immediately garnish with nonpareils, if desired. Let stand until chocolate is set, about 1 hour. Store in airtight container up to 5 days.
